story.iWant: initialize a Next.js project with Tailwind CSS
story.soThat: I have a modern foundation for building the user interface
story.tasks: - [ ] Run `npx create-next-app@latest frontend --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir=false --import-alias="@/*"` (AC: #1, #3) - [ ] Verify `frontend/` directory structure is created (AC: #3) - [ ] Confirm `tailwind.config.ts` is generated and configured (AC: #2) - [ ] Run `npm run dev` in `frontend/` (AC: #4) - [ ] Verify application starts on `localhost:3000` (AC: #4) - [ ] Visual verification of Tailwind CSS working (e.g., add a simple styled element) (AC: #2)

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. Next.js project created using `create-next-app` 2. Tailwind CSS configured and working 3. Project structure follows best practices (app directory) 4. Application runs locally on port 3000

story-context.constraints: - Monorepo Structure: `frontend/` directory must be at the project root. - Framework: Must use Next.js 15.x with App Router. - Styling: Must use Tailwind CSS. - Language: Must use TypeScript. - Package Manager: Must use npm. - Port: Application must run on localhost:3000.

tests.standards: Manual "Smoke Test" verification is the primary strategy for environment setup. This involves ensuring `npm run dev` starts without errors and the application is accessible via browser at `localhost:3000`.
tests.ideas: - Verify 'create-next-app' command execution success (AC #1) - Verify existence of 'frontend/' directory (AC #3) - Verify 'tailwind.config.ts' existence and content (AC #2) - Verify 'npm run dev' starts server on port 3000 (AC #4) - Verify visual styling via Tailwind class application (AC #2)
